Author: MCB999#4841
Content: Hello KMD labs. I was speaking with @jorian about integrating a new type of consensus algorithm for my own assetchain. What would be the necessary steps to do so?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @MCB999 what is it you're trying to do?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: what do you mean by consensus algo? The hashing algo?

Author: jorian#4555
Content: https://www.hpb.io/

Author: jorian#4555
Content: this goes 'above my hat', hope you can help

Author: MCB999#4841
Content: Thank you @jorian . I would like to create an assetchain on Komodo. But instead of PoW or PoS, I would like to use HPB's Proof of Performance consensus algorithm as well as their hardware for enhanced scalability and security of my assetchain.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I took a look at the website and the git. Is it not actually mining? Just choosing which node to give a block based on some condition? If so, what condition?

Author: MCB999#4841
Content: To my understanding it isn't mining but more of a consensus algorithm that allows the BOE hardware to perform a number of computing tasks that would otherwise have to take place on the software/chain itself, inherently slowing down the system. It also provides extra security will features such as true random number generating.

Author: MCB999#4841
Content: Data Fragmemtation, ECDSA Acceleration, Concurrency.

Author: MCB999#4841
Content: I assume the performance contribution would be the condition, but not sure.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I don't quite understand what "performance contribution" means, but you could likely make it work with a cryptocondition if you can clearly define  when a node should and shouldn't be rewarded a block

Author: MCB999#4841
Content: Thanks for the clarification

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think after all this messing around I finally understand the actual problem with MoMoM.... its not cool guys...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: What its doing, is using diffrent KMD heights  to calculate the MoMoM hash for iguana notarizations, and the signing of the import tx on KMD. Its like fatally flawed from the beginning. Im really not sure how to fix it at all.. Seems like the entire thing needs a pretty large redesign.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The issue is that when KMD is making the import transaction it uses the height of the notarization on KMD. but iguana just pickes som random number. There is not possible way these two ranges of MoM hashes can always 100% line up.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: To me, the validation of the import transaction is wrong. Instead of sending the MoMoM hash inside the import itself it should just be verifiing the TXID against the MoMoM hashes....The current way its doing ti is stupid... and makes little sense at all. I've thaught about this a lot... and making the MoMoM hash always line up 100% of the time doesnt seem possible.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: So the fix I am going to attempt, which should be only a change locally on how it validates, at least for now. the import wont propagate the mempool. ... but if I cna get it to validate then I can push another update.. Not sure what would happen to existing chains, so I would say newones need to be created to test it.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: This is likly to slow don the validation to a crawl ... as its going to need to loop fer a range of blocks, trying to verify the txid against all the MoMoM proofs until its gets the one that passes. This is how I thaught it was actaully working in the first place, but I know know this to not be the case... Its just looping the notarizations looking for a matchins MoMoM hash... which quite simply it will never always find, because there is 0 chance that they are always exacrly the same.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The 2 calls to Calcualte Proof Root MUST have the same input to get the same output. If this differs, its never going to work.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Maybe the call to Calcualte Proof Root can somehow, be standardized so that they always take some exact range...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
Doesnt seem possible to make it validate like that, as thats not how it works 😦 
It simply creates the MoMoM hash then compares that its equal ... there is no magical maths invloved really... So we are left with 2 options, using a frequency so large that there is almost 0 chance of something overlapping... like 15 or even 20 blocks... Which could still fail if there was a long block on KMD or the assetchain ...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Or I can try and make it always go backwards on KMD height by 10, and then move forward to the closest multiple of 5 ... This seems liek a simple solution, but in reality notarisations are not uinform enough to make 100% sure every 5 blocks there will be a MoMoM calcualted and sent to the target chain. Really not sure what to do now.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Maybe some way of redeeming lost burnt coins is the only solution... along with a frequency of 10. and minimum of 5 KMD blocks.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Not sure what that means to anything else built on top of the cross chain tech, as it seems anything that uses it will fail at some point when it enconters a gap, and not eveythign can use some redeeming contract for lost funds or something.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: I'm looking into storing https://komodostats.com/api/notary/summary.json on an oracle for visual display / twitbotting. Would this help at all with what you're trying to get done?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: really not sure man, but It seems to be that the MoMoM hash cannot be attached to notarizations if it needs to be 100% reliable ... bu using an oracle means the data is centralised... which is also no good... The only 100% reliaable way to do this is to make the assetchain, RPC directly to a full KMD node to get its MoMoM validation

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: This is just not a solution at all either... This is really shit... I dont understand why it was done this way... doesnt seems like this is how it has been expalined that it works at all.. It cheating and thus broken.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Either that or I'v never understood what Im working with here. I know that it worked 100% of the time with a freq of 15 before sapling broke the propagation of txns though the mempol.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: After sapling the KMD chain just doesnt mine transactions reliably ... not sure why, and cant work that out. Its on KMD so has nothing to do with mempool changes for CC chains.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Having to deal with this problem, has shown the flaws with this system.. it made way too many assumptions to be a reliable consesus validation.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think it needs a bigger hammer 🔨

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: If we just force it to notarize all the time and bail on each notarizaiton when it doesnt have the required data, it may magically work.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: So we need to use a freq of 5 KMD blocks, with a freq of 1 on the LABS chains themself. So it will just try and notarize every single block, but exit the round if 5 KMD blocks have not passed, and MoMoM hash is null.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: This will ALMOST guarentee that a notatzation happens every 5 KMD blocks,.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Then we can try and standardize the MoMoM hash calcuation to every 5KMd blocks, it must scan forwards to the first multiple of 5 blocks on KMD.

Author: jorian#4555
Content: so the issue is sapling?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: not really lol, that just doesnt help the situation. The issue is that 2 notarizations can be confirmed in the same block

Author: jorian#4555
Content: and a bug  concerning MoMoM?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: on KMD this is

Author: jorian#4555
Content: oh

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: that breaks everything... increasing the frequency to a much higehr number should help the situation ... but it wont help always

Author: jorian#4555
Content: well that tx propagation issue in KMD is something i noticed too

Author: jorian#4555
Content: and then mining them

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: definatly does happen ... no idea why. Alright also noticed it.

Author: jorian#4555
Content: so now we're going to work with something that is inherently broken?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It should be able to be fixed ... but its really not going to be easy or fast

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
We need to work out exactly what edge case is doign it, then prevent that frmo happening ... then increase freq out so that the edge case doenst happen very often. 
We can just sledgehammer the KMD sign setp to use a range of KMD heights, becasue one of them has to have a MoMoM returned that iguana has placed in a ntoarization.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: so if it fails for over an hour, go abck a step and add a block to the kmd height ... keep doing this until it passes valdiation

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: technicallty this will work.... but its not a very nice solution

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: so we slow it down, so that it doesnt happen much if at all, unless some extremly rare case where there are either no blocks or lots of blocks in some time period.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: brainstormed some ideas and just one of the approaches needs to work. the first step is to get it 100% reliable at slow speed, then and only then to speed it up

Content: So far, I have nul MoMoM theoretically sorted.
